content:
Xiao Rucheng, Professor of Tongji University, chairman of Bridge and Structural Engineering Branch of China Civil Engineering Society, editorial board member of the China Civil Engineering Journal, Applied Mathematics and Mechanics and several other magazines, and judge of the National Science and Technology Progress Award.
The main research fields of Prof. Xiao include the design theory, structural system, and the analysis & management system of long-span bridges. He has been PI of many research projects including the program of National Natural Science Foundation of China and won several science and technology progress awards. He has presided over the design of arch bridges such as the Guotai Bridge in Tianjin and won a number of design awards. He was the design consultant of arch bridges such as the Lupu Bridge and received a number of government consultancy awards. He worked as an expert committee member for bridges such as the Ai’zhai Bridge, and is currently serving as an expert committee member for bridges such as the Longtan Bridge and the Tsing Lung Bridge in Hong Kong.
Prof. Xiao has published more than 200 academic papers and authored books such as Bridge Structural System and Bridge Structure Analysis and Program System.
summary: Xiao Rucheng, Professor of Tongji University, chairman of Bridge and Structural Engineering Branch of China Civil Engineering Society, editorial board member of the China Civil Engineering Journal, Applied Mathematics and Mechanics and several other magazines, and judge of the National Science and Technology Progress Award.
title: Rucheng Xiao

content:
Flexibility This feature can be used for publishing content such as:
 Online courses Project or software documentation Tutorials  The courses folder may be renamed. For example, we can rename it to docs for software/project documentation or tutorials for creating an online course.
Delete tutorials To remove these pages, delete the courses folder and see below to delete the associated menu link.
Update site menu After renaming or deleting the courses folder, you may wish to update any [[main]] menu links to it by editing your menu configuration at config/_default/menus.toml.
For example, if you delete this folder, you can remove the following from your menu configuration:
[[main]] name = "Courses" url = "courses/" weight = 50  Or, if you are creating a software documentation site, you can rename the courses folder to docs and update the associated Courses menu configuration to:
[[main]] name = "Docs" url = "docs/" weight = 50  Update the docs menu If you use the docs layout, note that the name of the menu in the front matter should be in the form [menu.X] where X is the folder name. Hence, if you rename the courses/example/ folder, you should also rename the menu definitions in the front matter of files within courses/example/ from [menu.example] to [menu.<NewFolderName>].
summary: Learn how to use Academic's docs layout for publishing online courses, software documentation, and tutorials.
title: Overview

title: Example Page 2

content: To commemorate the 110th birthday of our beloved teacher, Professor Guohao Li, a large photo album entitled Bridges in China (2013-2023) was published to record the remarkable achievements of Chinese bridge engineering in the last 10 years.
summary: To commemorate the 110th birthday of our beloved teacher, Professor Guohao Li, a large photo album entitled Bridges in China (2013-2023) was published to record the remarkable achievements of Chinese bridge engineering in the last 10 years.
title: Album entitled Bridges in China (2013-2023) was published

content:
Prof. Xiao was invited to give a keynote speech at the Second World Conference on Long Span Arch Bridge Construction Technology held from March 19 – 21 in Nanning, GuangXi Zhuang Autonomous Region, China.
The presentation was titled “Past and Present of Arch Bridges — Also Discussing Innovations of Arch Bridges”. From the Corbel arch over 4000 years ago to the stone arch bridge of the Mycenaean Civilization, from the ancient arch bridge of the Rome period to the Bayonne Bridge, the brilliance of the arch bridge in the past is shown. Then, from several points of view, including the development of bridge span and application of new material, the structural system and key structural member, the construction method, the calculation theory and analysis method, the innovation of the arch bridge after World War II is presented. It is revealed that only innovation can help to achieve longer spans and diverse structural forms of arch bridges. Possible directions for the future development of arch bridges are discussed in the last part.
summary: Prof. Xiao was invited to give a keynote speech at the Second World Conference on Long Span Arch Bridge Construction Technology held from March 19 – 21 in Nanning, GuangXi Zhuang Autonomous Region, China.
title: Prof. Xiao was invited to give a keynote speech

content:
Create slides in Markdown with Academic  Academic | Documentation
 Features  Efficiently write slides in Markdown 3-in-1: Create, Present, and Publish your slides Supports speaker notes Mobile friendly slides   Controls  Next: Right Arrow or Space Previous: Left Arrow Start: Home Finish: End Overview: Esc Speaker notes: S Fullscreen: F Zoom: Alt + Click  PDF Export: E   Code Highlighting Inline code: variable
Code block:
porridge = "blueberry" if porridge == "blueberry": print("Eating...")   Math In-line math: $x + y = z$
Block math:
$$ f\left( x \right) = ;\frac{{2\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x - 4} \right)}}{{\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x + 1} \right)}} $$
 Fragments Make content appear incrementally
{{% fragment %}} One {{% /fragment %}} {{% fragment %}} **Two** {{% /fragment %}} {{% fragment %}} Three {{% /fragment %}}  Press Space to play!
One  Two  Three 
 A fragment can accept two optional parameters:
 class: use a custom style (requires definition in custom CSS) weight: sets the order in which a fragment appears   Speaker Notes Add speaker notes to your presentation
{{% speaker_note %}} - Only the speaker can read these notes - Press `S` key to view {{% /speaker_note %}}  Press the S key to view the speaker notes!
 Only the speaker can read these notes Press S key to view    Themes  black: Black background, white text, blue links (default) white: White background, black text, blue links league: Gray background, white text, blue links beige: Beige background, dark text, brown links sky: Blue background, thin dark text, blue links    night: Black background, thick white text, orange links serif: Cappuccino background, gray text, brown links simple: White background, black text, blue links solarized: Cream-colored background, dark green text, blue links   Custom Slide Customize the slide style and background
{{< slide background-image="/img/boards.jpg" >}} {{< slide background-color="#0000FF" >}} {{< slide class="my-style" >}}   Custom CSS Example Let’s make headers navy colored.
Create assets/css/reveal_custom.css with:
.reveal section h1, .reveal section h2, .reveal section h3 { color: navy; }   Questions?  Ask
 Documentation
summary: An introduction to using Academic's Slides feature.

title: An example journal article

content: Yufeng Bridge completed in 2005, is located in Yushan Town, Kunshan City and crosses the Yehe River. The bridge has a total length of about 330 meters and six lanes in dual direction. Yufeng Bridge is the first long-span leaning-type arch bridge without thrust in China, primarily designed by the Long-span Bridge Research Group of Tongji University. The main bridge of Yufeng Bridge adopts a system of leaning-type arch bridges without thrust and arch beam hinged connection system. The main span is 110 meters, and the widest part of the bridge deck is 60.9 meters with a height of 27 meters.
summary: Yufeng Bridge completed in 2005, is located in Yushan Town, Kunshan City and crosses the Yehe River. The bridge has a total length of about 330 meters and six lanes in dual direction.
title: Yufeng Bridge
